intro: Saccolabium distichum, commonly known as the two-ranked salsify, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, yellow flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Saccolabium distichum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
